newsitem.title: UK: MTL Trust wins Merseyrail Electrics franchise.
newsitem.headline: MTL Trust wins Merseyrail Electrics franchise.

text.p: Britain's Office of Passenger Rail Franchising (Opfraf) said on Friday it had awarded the Merseyrail Electrics Limited passenger rail franchise to MTL Trust Holdings.
The franchise has been let for approximately seven years and two months, the office said.

MTL has agreed to comply with the minimum passenger service requirement for the October 1997 timetable which should be an improvement on existing service levels, said the franchising director John O'Brien in a statement.

The group has also committed itself to spending 6.8 million stg on additional security including surveillance cameras at train stations and plans for a security team to deal with problems like vandalism.
The subsidy from the government will be 80.7 million stg in the first year, falling to 60.8 million in 2003/4.
Passenger revenue for the year ended March 1996 was 18.7 million stg.
